brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of the investigators study is to investigate the factors associated with
      rebleeding in patients with peptic ulcer bleeding.

clinical_study.brief_title: Risk Factors of Rebleeding After Peptic Ulcer Bleeding: a Nationwide Cohort Study

detailed_description.textblock:
The investigators are performing a nationwide population based cohort study to investigate
      the factors associated with rebleeding in patients with peptic ulcer bleeding. The results
      of the investigators study should give us information about patients who are at high risk of
      rebleeindg and enable us to manage these patients appropriately.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients diagnosed with peptic ulcer bleeding by endoscopy

          -  Patients who consent to be enrolled in the study

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients who refuse to be enrolled in the study

study_pop.textblock:
Patients who visit the hospital with symptoms suggestive of peptic ulcer bleeding such as
        melena or hematemesis. These patients recieve endoscopy and when they are diagnosed with
        peptic ulcer bleeding are eligible for enrollment.

clinical_study.official_title: Risk Factors of Rebleeding After Peptic Ulcer Bleeding: a Nationwide Cohort Study

overall_official.affiliation: Incheon St. Mary's Hospital, The Catholic University of Korea

oversight_info.authority: Korea: National Strategic Coordinating Center for Clinical Research

primary_outcome.description: The rebleeding rate of patients diagnosed with peptic ulcer ble4eding
primary_outcome.measure: Rebleeding rate of peptic ulcer bleeding

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Clinical assistant proffessor, Department of Internal medicine, Incheon St. Mary's Hospital

secondary_outcome.description: The 30 day mortality rate of patients diagnosed with peptic ulcer bleeding
secondary_outcome.measure: Mortality rates of peptic ulcer bleeding

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
